intro: Bidens campylotheca subsp. waihoiensis, commonly known as the Waihōiensi Bidens, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The species is distinguished by its small, yellow disc flowers surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. It typically grows in damp, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind.
